etymologies: late Middle English: from medieval Latin tamarindus, from Arabic tamr hindī ‘Indian date’

definitions: sticky brown acidic pulp from the pod of a tree of the pea family, widely used as a flavoring in Asian cooking.
shortDefinitions: sticky brown acidic pulp from pod of tree of pea family

definitions: the pod from which tamarind is extracted.
shortDefinitions: pod from which tamarind pulp is extracted

definitions: the tropical African tree that yields tamarind, cultivated throughout the tropics and also grown as an ornamental and shade tree.
shortDefinitions: tropical African tree which yields tamarind pods
